_header: All wholy yours withouten others part
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 122.
Subjects: lovers, addresses to beloved; lover’s lament; complaints
_description: ‘Complaint to my mortal foe’ — four 8-line stanzas

BLHar7578.First Lines:
[A]l holly youres with outhen others parteWherefore I wille that I
                    ne can ne may…
BLHar7578.Last Lines:
…Sith I am youres til deth my herte wel kerueOn me youre man
                    new mercy haue and wirth
BLHar7578.Note:
Initial ᰰ’A is missing, with space left for illuminated
                    initial.
